Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameManagerInterface

    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameManagerInterface
    GameManager defines how the game is set up and calls the methods needed for the game to be played.
    Author:
    Steven Lowes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameManager()
      Create a new GameManager with a GUI display of max height and width 500 pixels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameManager

        public GameManager()
        Create a new GameManager with a GUI display of max height and width 500 pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • specifyPlayer

        public boolean specifyPlayer(PlayerInterface player,
                             Piece colour)
                      throws ColourAlreadySetException,
                             InvalidColourException
        Define who will be playing each colour. This method will be called twice for each game once for RED and once for BLUE.
        Specified by:
        specifyPlayer in interface GameManagerInterface
        Parameters:
        player - the player who will be playing red
        colour - the enum for a Piece (RED or BLUE)
        Returns:
        boolean true if the player was successfully set to the specified colour
        Throws:
        ColourAlreadySetException - If the colour is already allocated to a player
        InvalidColourException

      • boardSize

        public boolean boardSize(int sizeX,
                         int sizeY)
                  throws InvalidBoardSizeException,
                         BoardAlreadySizedException
        Specifiy the size of the board that we are playing on. Both numbers must be greater than zero
        Specified by:
        boardSize in interface GameManagerInterface
        Parameters:
        sizeX - how wide the board will be
        sizeY - how tall the board will be
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful operation
        Throws:
        InvalidBoardSizeException - If either size value is less than one.
        BoardAlreadySizedException - If the board has already been created.

      • playGame

        public boolean playGame()
        The core of the game manager. This requests each player to make a move and plays these out on the game board. It is also checked whether the game is won and if so reported to the players that that is the case.
        Specified by:
        playGame in interface GameManagerInterface
        Returns:
        boolean indicating successful operation

      • getWon

        public Piece getWon()
             throws NoBoardDefinedException
        Calls board.gameWon()
        Returns:
        Piece value indicating game won, Piece.RED for red wins, Piece.BLUE for blue wins, Piece.UNSET for no winner yet.
        Throws:
        NoBoardDefinedException - the board has not been defined - call boardSize.
